intro: Polygala apopetala, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its unique, delicate inflorescence that resembles a cluster of tiny, translucent flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Polygala apopetala is considered a protected species in many areas.
